Stage Selection
-1st Match starts at Club Murder. Loser picks the next stage.

-Players may not pick a stage they've won on previously in the set

Character Selection
-After a match the loser may elect to pick first, the winner is character locked if the character they played in the previous match is was not stolen from them.

-Before a set, players may request a coin toss or rock paper scissors for first pick, if no request is made, characters are picked as normal.
Rules-Glitches:
Infinites
-Infinites on the boxing rings, on flood lights, at empty areas of the stage, and using the roll off the wall, as well as the wall redaze are banned and will result in a forfeit of that round in the set with the following exception:

-All infinities are allowed to be performed for one rep then a combo ender must be performed except for the wall redaze infinite, which is never allowed.

-The infinite using Crowâ€™s Officeâ€™s cabinet in the lower right corner is allowed for one rep per combo per the one rep rule

-The Strike Infinite is LEGAL.

-Using any grapple move that ignores the double down stun limit, i.e. chain stun grabs, are limited to one per combo except in the case of Blazin moves and a specific wall grab animation that causes an additional stun.

-No stalling when using a heavy grab. This rule was created because it bypasses the stun system and creates for long infinites.

-Fall Resets are completely banned.

Rules-Game Settings:
Time: 90 seconds
Damage: Normal
Climax Time: On
Final Reflect: On
Info-Software Needed: just dolphin and the game, both of which i'll be able to provide
Rules-Glitches:
The Finisher Mode Throw Cancel bug is banned.

Any bug that causes a character to disappear or otherwise causes the match to become unplayable is banned.

Combo follow-ups after attacks that disable the opponent's burst are banned.
    This affects Kabuto, Den-O (PWR), Fourze (Meteor Fusion States), Fourze (Astroswitches), OOO (Burakawani), and Kiva.
        A Kiva Rider Art which does not complete must be immediately followed up with 5S.
    This does not affect Kuuga (PWR) or Imperer, as their relevant cinematics (Ultimate Kuuga's Rider Art and Imperer's Rider Finale) do not disable burst.

Zeronos may not transform between Vega Form and Zero Form, and vice versa.
    If Zeronos transforms from Vega to Zero or vice versa, then the player must immediately transform back to Altair Form.

Decade (FMC) and Fourze (Elek/Fire States) are not allowed to use Form Change 3 times (or more) within the span of 2 seconds.
Rules-Notes:
Banned Characters: Faiz (SPD), W LunaTrigger (FMC), Wizard Hurricane Style (FMC), Fourze (SPT), Fourze (Astroswitches), Skull, Agito (SPT), Den-O (SPT + Gun Form), Den-O (PWR + Gun Form), Garren, Drake, Blade (Jack Form)

Tag Battle Style is banned, except when used to choose Fourze Meteor Fusion States.

This tournament will be played on the community's Stage Patch, which replaces banned stages and expands the stage selection. No other gameplay changes are made in the Stage Patch.
The first game of a set is always played on a random stage.
The loser of the previous game in a set manually selects the stage.

Both players must simultaneously announce which character they want to play upon entering Character Select. If both players wish to play the same character, play RPS to decide who gets to pick that character â€” loser must pick another character. In the event that RPS is not feasible, another method, such as coin flip or dice call, will be used instead.
    The winning player of a game must pick the character they won the previous game with, but is allowed to change Style. The losing player may opt to pick a different character, as well as a different stage should they choose to do so. The losing player may opt to pick the winnerâ€™s character going into the next game. In the event of this, both players play RPS (or a suitable alternative).
        If the initiating player wins this game of RPS, the defending player must pick a new character, but the initiating player forfeits their right to pick the stage to the defending player. If the initiating player loses the game of RPS, they forfeit the right to pick a new character, and the defending player selects the stage.

Tournament copy: Power Rangers: Battle for the Grid (PC)
$-Prizes: A custom-made arcade stick with new artwork of Lord Drakkon from NWay for 1st place.
Rules-Game Settings: Players must pick training stage unless both mutually agree on a different stage
Rules-Notes:
Winner must keep characters. Loser may switch.
SPD Unblockables Banned (Following applies if you're using the SPD Zord)
- You can't use the M call debuff on an incoming opponent until the opponent's character touches the ground
- You can't swap strike if the opponent's character has an air M call debuff
--- Doing either of these will result in a game loss
Info-Comments: Under no circumstances should BFTG be scheduled near UMVC3 or 2XKO. Also, whoever is streaming it should be able to handle streaming a 120fps from a PC. We ran into an issue with the streamers from last year, and I want to avoid that scenario again. If there's a need for a change, please let me know.

Rules-Game Settings:
- Quota: 300 levels / 4'00" timer
- All game settings set to default, except:

  -- Next display style in operation mode TGM: TGM
  -- Display input during game: ON

- First set takes place in Shiranui VS. Loser of the set may counterpick a different mode
- Both Standard and TGM control types permitted
- All USB controllers and keyboards permitted provided they are recognized by Steam / TGM4

Rules-Notes:
- Losing a game with Tiria, Comic Mode Serika, or Rapid Ayaka counts as losing 2 games.
  - You can only pick them when losing 1 game would not result in losing the set.
  - Outside of finals, they can only be picked at the start of the set, and losing 1 game results in losing the set.
  - During finals, they can be selected either at the start of the set, or after losing one game on an unrestricted character. If selected at the start of the set and the player loses, they must swap to an unrestricted character.

Info-Comments:
This game potentially needs to be ran as FT1 until finals depending on how skilled the player pool is, me and skytanks thought 2 hours was enough to get through pools for 29 people. We were wrong, we needed 3. That was FT2 for most of the bracket on 4 setups, and only 1 dq. I am keeping it on ft2 for now but that may change.

Since this is a MiSter game, I expect my and other MiSter setups will be shared for other games that need them. I am at least happy to provide mine for whatever is needed

Update 1/23/2026 - CAP WAS SET ON START.GG AS 48. Noticed this when someone registered past cap. Set cap to 33 afterwards. In the interest of not booting anyone we are rocking with it.

Post Frosty Update 2/3/2026 - Skytanks and Shib Provided the additional setups for TSS.
